Poor Nutrition: The runner may not have a well-balanced diet, leading to inadequate fueling, dehydration, and a decrease in performance.
Inadequate Rest and Recovery: The runner may not have allowed sufficient time for rest and recovery between training sessions, leading to muscle fatigue and increased risk of injury.
Inadequate Hydration: The runner may not have properly hydrated before, during, or after the race, leading to dehydration and decreased performance.
Poor Equipment: The runner may be using poorly fitting or inappropriate footwear, leading to discomfort and an increased risk of injury.
Inadequate Warm-up and Cool-down: The runner may not have properly warmed up before the race or cooled down after, leading to muscle strains and injuries.
